Fixed quotes per [[MOS:PUNCT]] + [[WP:CHECKWIKI]] error fixes + [[WP:GENFIXES|general fixes]], replaced: “ → ", ” → " (5) using [[Project:AWB|AWB]] (7641)

/* Controversies */ Corrected an incorrect reference which I added a moment ago. Bhutto is not the only one to ever make a mistake. OK, really, I am logging off now! Thanks to anyone who reviews this edit.
/* Controversies */ Removed an unnecessary link to the current article. But truly: I have nothing further to ADD, and am logging out now. :)

/* Controversies */ I accept Nick's previous edit re: Bhutto, Pakistan, etc. Adding a fact concerning Bhutto's misattribution to Spencer of the passage she criticized. Hopefully this is on topic. Nothing further to add.

/* Controversies */ Stylistic edit: Tighten up verbose wording about Spencer's refusal (e.g., "public" is implicit in the reference to Spencer's written statement, "to convert to Islam" is implicit in the preceding sentences).

/* Controversies */ Use ellipses to abbreviate Gadahn's quote, except as directly applicable to Spencer. Remove an unnecessary mention of Daniel Pipes' refusal (Pipes and Gadahn both have their own full articles).
this doesn't seem to add any factual content about Spencer to the article
/* Controversies */ Add the references for statements on responsibility for Benazir Bhutto's assassination.
/* Controversies */ Correct the wiki syntax in the reference I just added.
/* Controversies */ Punctuation: Delete a redundant period.
/* Controversies */ Added a few facts (with references and links) to what had been a very brief assessment of controversy in Pakistan.
/* Criticism */ Add a name attribute to the reference to Benazir Bhutto's criticism of Spencer.
/* Controversies */ WP:NPOV: Add links to the Wikipedia articles related to "crusader" and "missionaries", which might otherwise appear to be pejorative terms.

/* Controversies */ Mention the duration of the video (which is substantiated in the article on Gadahn). Minor stylistic edits: Break up a run-on sentence; replace "referenced" with "referred to"; use italics for the name of the video.
/* Controversies */ Link to Wikipedia's article on the FBI.
/* Controversies */ Clarify the controversy surrounding the "Invitation" video, by noting the severe consequences it had for Adam Gadahn.
/* Controversies */ Punctuation: delete a redundant period.
/* Controversies */ Add references to substantiate that Spencer calls Islam "supremacist".
/* Controversies */ Add a quotation from an essay of Osama bin Laden, to shed light on Spencer's controversial refusal to convert to Islam.
/* Controversies */ Sort the controversies chronologically (oldest first).
WP:NPOV: Absorbed the contents of the "Political fallout" section into the more neutrally named heading "Controversies".

/* Controversies */ Rewrite for the sake WP:NPOV, i.e., to describe the controversy without participating in it. Also, focus more closely on controversy concerning Robert Spencer, who is the subject of this article.
/* Controversies */ Remove unnecessary underscore from the link to Wikipedia title The Tennessean.
